quickstart.title: Quick Start
quickstart.subtitle: Get your first haex-vault extension running in just 5 minutes.

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: In this guide, you'll create a simple extension that demonstrates the core SDK features. By the end, you'll have a working extension ready for development.

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.intro: Before you begin, make sure you have the following installed:

createProject.title: Create Your Project
createProject.intro: We'll use Vite with Vue, but you can use any framework (React, Svelte, or vanilla JS).

step1.title: Initialize Project
step1.description: Create a new Vite project and install the SDK:

step2.title: Configure the Plugin
step2.description: Update your main.ts to use the haex plugin:

step3.title: Use the SDK
step3.description: Replace your App.vue with this example:

createProject.note: The haex init command creates your manifest.json, keypair, and icon files in the haextension folder.

runExtension.title: Run Your Extension
runExtension.intro: Start the development server and load your extension in haex-vault:
runExtension.loadInVault: Open haex-vault and load your extension from the development URL (usually http://localhost:5173).
runExtension.warning: Keep your private.key safe! Never commit it to version control.

nextSteps.title: Next Steps
nextSteps.intro: Now that you have a working extension, explore these guides to add more functionality:
